item.description: FREE Live Music every Monday - Funk, Soul, Jazz, Reggae styles.

item.title: Monday, 24th February 2014 - 8:00pm Circus Society Meeting in The Cinema
item.description: At circus society we're all about meeting people, getting involved and having fun. Everyone has fun teaching and learning new tricks together, and we highly encourage members to learn and develop performance skills. We cater for a wide range of skill levels, welcoming both complete beginners and experts, and have a range of our own circus equipment so that anyone can join in and learn tricks straight away.
item.dc:creator: Circus Society

item.title: Monday, 24th February 2014 - 8:30pm Spinning with Road Cycling in Jubilee
item.description:
Come spinning with the road cycling club for an unbeatable price! It is a great way to get some high quality cycling done in a neat 1 hour timeframe!
Sessions take place in the spinning room (in front of the pool's changing room) in the Jubilee Sports Centre.
Please email surc@soton.ac.uk at least 24 hours before the session to reserve a spot.
Sportwell membership not required, further reductions available for members. Please email for more details.
surc@soton.ac.uk
item.dc:creator: Road (Cycling)

item.description:
Come and vote in the SUSU Elections using the voting booths on the SUSU concourse!
Or you can vote online at www.susu.org/vote

item.description: Join SUSU LGBT for lunch in The Bridge at 1pm on Tuesdays and Thursdays. See our website (lgbt.susu.org), our Facebook page (facebook.com/susulgbt) or contact a committee member for more information.

item.title: Tuesday, 25th February 2014 - 6:00pm The Bridge Wine Deal in The Bridge
item.description: Weekly deal. Buy two glasses of wine, get the rest of the bottle free.
item.dc:creator: SUSU

item.title: Tuesday, 25th February 2014 - 6:00pm USO x Malaysia Society Meeting in 02/2043
item.description:
United as One Society proudly presents the next meeting on Tuesday with Malaysia Society. We will have a brief presentation about Malaysia and follow with two interesting discussions. 1. How often people mix up Malaysia and Singapore? 2. Multinational culture No worry if you know nothing about Malaysia or have never been to USO meetings. Everyone is welcome. Please come along with friends!
One exciting news is that USO Society decides to join international culture show. So anyone would like to sing and dance with us, you are more than welcome!!!!! It must be so much fun. For more details, we will explain on Tuesday night. xx
item.dc:creator: United As One Society

item.title: Tuesday, 25th February 2014 - 9:30pm Don Jon at Union Films
item.description: <p>A New Jersey guy dedicated to his family, friends, and church, develops unrealistic expectations from watching porn and works to find happiness and intimacy with his potential true love.</p>
item.dc:creator: Union Films

item.title: Wednesday, 26th February 2014 - 2:00pm Zumba+ Society Class in The Cube
item.description:
So you heard about Zumba+ from a friend? Housemate? On the fresher?s welcome page? Zumba+ society runs several fitness classes every week, at student friendly prices. Everyone is welcome, no experience of Zumba or Bokwa needed, and best of all you don?t need a gym membership to get involved!
CLASSES: Zumba - every MONDAY AND WEDNESDAY, 2-3pm in the CUBE Bokwa - every FRIDAY, 2-3pm in the CUBE
PRICE: Members £2 per class Non members £3 per class Membership is £5 and the perks include: cheaper classes (£2 instead of £3 per class), a stamp card (pay for 5 classes, get the 6th free), 10% of merchandise and a free drink on socials!
ESSENTIAL KIT: Please wear suitable shoes, grippy trainers are the best and remember to bring plenty of water.
FAQs: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nkvcoXKpz33VMxFFr2j700yW9prLLErQkMIJRTARm80/edit?usp=sharing Please check this for any general questions. If your question is not answered here then please send us a facebook message or an email (zumsoc@soton.ac.uk)
Lots of love, The Zumsoc Team
item.dc:creator: Zumba+

item.title: Wednesday, 26th February 2014 - 4:00pm Amnesty International Weekly Meeting in 58/1039
item.description: Amnesty International is an organisation that stands up for Human Rights across the world, from children wanting an education in Afghanistan, to an innocent man on death row in America. Come to our weekly meetings where we vote, discuss, debate and then try to be the change we want to see in the world!
item.dc:creator: Amnesty International

item.description: CGSOC weekly meetings! Come along to play games, Chat and have fun!
item.dc:creator: Computer Game Society

item.title: Wednesday, 26th February 2014 - 5:00pm Language Session in 85/2207, pod1, Nuffield theathre lecture theatre A
item.description:
Weekly FREE Japanese Language Session is back on Wednesday!
We are very excited to announce the next Japanese session takes place on Wednesday the 5th of February!
In the session, you will be introduced to Group 2 and Group 3 verbs.
Any members interested in learning Japanese are welcome!
Membership is required to attend the session. Haven?t got one yet? The membership costs you only 3 pounds for 3 years. The fee includes a member card, access to the Japanese library and free entrance to the cultural event we hold later in the year.
This language session will be held at the lecture room 2207 in Building 85 on Highfield Campus, 5.00 ? 6.00 PM .
Following the one on the 5th February, we will hold the language session every Wednesday, 12th, 19th, 26th of February and the 5th, 12th and 19th of March.
Don?t miss this exciting opportunity to learn Japanese!
item.dc:creator: Japanese Society

item.title: Wednesday, 26th February 2014 - 6:00pm You Present, Your Event! in The Bridge
item.description: A designated time and space for our student groups to run their own events and activities. You present your event.
item.dc:creator: SUSU

item.title: Wednesday, 26th February 2014 - 7:00pm Comedy Workshop in Murray Building (58)
item.description: Strange things are happening in The Murray Building every Wednesday at 19:00. The dark underbelly of Performing Arts that is Comedy Society gather together to probe the boundaries of humour and excite each others larynxes. Come along for an evening of Improv Games, Sketch Writing, Show Planning and Stand Up. You don't have to get involved we love an audience, simply turn up and laugh then head to the pub afterwards to talk all things Comedy.
item.dc:creator: Comedy Society
